8 Nov 2019

Evolutionary Genomics & Comparative Methods

We are interested in studying genome diversity across multiple phylogenetic scales. Check out our study on microsatellite evolution across 450 million years of vertebrate genome evolution.
Also, check out our collaborative work on venom evolution, the Garter snake genome, the Prairie rattlesnake genome, and the evolution of transposable elements across vertebrate genomes.
 

Probabilistic models of character trait evolution have become invaluable tools across many fields of evolutionary biology. We have initiated several projects aimed at developing new approaches for studying the evolution of continuous character traits across deep evolutionary time. Stay tuned!
